body_html:
The command that I used to clone the github repo:
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow

Only our /tmp folder is almost full, so I have a export TMPDIR=.... to an alternative directory to use as temporary folder. Could this be the problem? I noticed a couple of 'source' commands in the bazel output, so maybe this tmpdir variable is overwritten?
body_text:
The command that I used to clone the github repo:
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
Only our /tmp folder is almost full, so I have a export TMPDIR=.... to an alternative directory to use as temporary folder. Could this be the problem? I noticed a couple of 'source' commands in the bazel output, so maybe this tmpdir variable is overwritten?
body: The command that I used to clone the github repo: git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow Only our /tmp folder is almost full, so I have a export TMPDIR=.... to an alternative directory to use as temporary folder. Could this be the problem? I noticed a couple of 'source' commands in the bazel output, so maybe this tmpdir variable is overwritten?
